result.execSummary:
The defendant Donald E Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Donald E Wells is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Donald E Wells was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

10:17 AM Defendant Donald E Wells Jr in court.  Attorney Dominic Richards in court for Donald E Wells Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Peggy A. Crooks-Mishacoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. Cases called 22 CF 323 and 22 TR 3710. Rights/ Elements. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds defendant guilty. Judgment to be entered. Counts 2, 3, and 4 dismissed, 22 TR 210 dismissed, Court sentences defendant to $579 costs/ fines due in 60 days or with payment plan, DNA sample. $500.00 on deposit to be used towards the costs. 3 days jail credit. 10:25 AM
